lines.text: It's the feeling that everything, so to say, out there has been prearranged, and all you have is a sliver of stage to act on. I don't know what to call it.
Paranoia?
Ha! I've always wanted to be an artsy fartsy arsehole, Anna. That's why I subscribe to that wonderful magazine, what's it called? Sight and Sound!
What a lucky boy you turned out to be, eh?
I don't give a pint of horse piss about your private life! This is where you get paid, this is where you bring your pretty little arse, on time!
I have a whole team set to eliminate a Mister Pig Mallion. A joke I'm sure eludes you.
It's like some sort of story, and it's gone all wrong!

[Editing]
Can I say this?
Of course.
...Och, you're fond of the wee lassy, the noo.
What are you saying? Take your kilt off!
I'm saying, Nick, that it shows!
But it's the crucial, comic, character defining moment. "Each night I ask the stars up above, why must I be a teenager in love?"
It's too on the nose.
Yes, right bang on the snoz, love!
They all start looking the same, don't they?
Listen, if you've dropped me in it, you're not going to like the look of your pretty face any more, and that's a promise.
Don't say that, Arthur, please.
What's it called, your story?
Karaoke.
An obstruction in the pancreas.
Is that a euphemism, don't you mean growth?
Ah, but we don't know if it's benign or malignant.
An obstruction. Well, it's what I've always wanted to be.
Stressed? Me? I'M AS GENTLE AS THE BEAT OF AN ANGEL'S WING!
